title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.
speech: Identify what you are solving for.
pacedSpeech: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the Phuong's speed on the flat street.
speech: You are solving for the Phuong's speed on the flat street.
pacedSpeech: You are solving for the Phuong's speed on the flat street.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent his speed on a flat street. Let the variable be $$x$$.
speech: Create a variable to represent his speed on a flat street. Let the variable be  x .
pacedSpeech: Create a variable to represent his speed on a flat street. Let the variable be   x

title: Time Elapsed
text: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.
speech: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.
pacedSpeech: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.

title: Time Elapsed Answer
text: 10:00 PM to 11:15 PM is $$1.25$$ hours. 11:15 PM to 11:45 PM is $$0.5$$ hours long. So, he spent $$1.25$$ hours biking on a flat street and $$0.5$$ hours biking uphill.
speech: 10:00 PM to 11:15 PM is  1.25  hours. 11:15 PM to 11:45 PM is  0.5  hours long. So, he spent  1.25  hours biking on a flat street and  0.5  hours biking uphill.
pacedSpeech: hours biking on a flat street and   0.5

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that $$distance=speed time$$.
speech: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that , distance is equal to speedtime .
pacedSpeech: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that  , distance is equal to speedtime

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation $$1.25x+\operatorname{0.5}\left(0.6x\right)=31$$ (this is the overall distance).
speech: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation  1.25 x plus 0.5 of 0.6 x is equal to 31  (this is the overall distance).
pacedSpeech: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the journey to get the equation   1.25 x plus 0.5 of 0.6 x is equal to 31

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for $$x$$?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$1.25x+\operatorname{0.5}\left(0.6x\right)=31$$, we follow these steps: 1.25x+0.3x=31-->1.55x=31-->x=20.

speech: After solving the equation, what do you get for  x ?
